intro: Arytera, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that often display vibrant yellow or orange hues. They typically grow in moist, well-drained soils and are found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Arytera species are perennial herbs that often feature hairy stems and opposite leaves. Their flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
